# Pressemeldung per E-Mail versenden

## Zeitgesteuerter Versand

### Wann ist geplanter Versand sinnvoll?

- **Optimaler Zeitpunkt**: Versende zu Zeiten, wenn Journalisten ihre E-Mails lesen (z.B. Dienstag 10:00 Uhr)
- **Zeitzone**: Versende an internationale Kontakte zur richtigen Tageszeit

## Versand-Status verstehen

Nach dem Versand durchl√§uft jede E-Mail verschiedene Status:

### Status-√úbersicht

### Bounce-Typen

**Hard Bounce** (Permanent):


- **Schlecht**: < 10%

- **Sehr gut**: > 10%
- **Gut**: 5-10%
- **Durchschnitt**: 2-5%
- **Schlecht**: < 2%


[Screenshot: Versand-Metriken im Monitoring-Dashboard]

## Was passiert technisch beim Versand?

### 1. Job-Erstellung (0 Sekunden)

### 2. E-Mail-Generierung (1-30 Sekunden)

- F√ºr jeden Empf√§nger wird eine personalisierte E-Mail erstellt
- Platzhalter werden ersetzt (z.B. {{Vorname}}, {{Nachname}})

### 3. Versand (30 Sekunden - 10 Minuten)

- E-Mails werden **portionsweise** versendet (Rate Limiting)

## H√§ufige Fehler vermeiden

**L√∂sungen:**

3. **Versandzeitpunkt**: Dienstag-Donnerstag, 09:00-11:00 Uhr

- [ ] Kein √ºberm√§√üiger Einsatz von Gro√übuchstaben oder Sonderzeichen
- [ ] Verh√§ltnis Text/Bild ist ausgewogen (nicht nur Bilder)
- [ ] Keine zu gro√üen Anh√§nge (max. 5 MB)
- [ ] Abmelde-Link ist vorhanden (automatisch enthalten)
- [ ] "From"-Domain und "Return-Path"-Domain stimmen √ºberein

## Tipps f√ºr erfolgreichen Versand

### Tipp 1: Versende zu optimalen Zeiten

**B2B-Journalisten:**
- **Beste Tage**: Dienstag, Mittwoch, Donnerstag
- **Beste Zeiten**: 09:00-11:00 Uhr oder 14:00-16:00 Uhr
- **Vermeiden**: Montag vor 10:00 Uhr, Freitag nach 15:00 Uhr, Wochenenden

**Consumer-Medien:**
- **Beste Tage**: Montag bis Freitag
- **Beste Zeiten**: 10:00-12:00 Uhr

### Tipp 2: Nutze A/B-Testing (Premium)

- Versende 10% an Test-Gruppe mit **Betreff A**
- Versende 10% an Test-Gruppe mit **Betreff B**
- Der Betreff mit h√∂herer √ñffnungsrate gewinnt
- Versende restliche 80% mit Gewinner-Betreff

### Tipp 3: Segmentiere deine Verteilerlisten

**Warum segmentieren?**
- Relevantere Inhalte f√ºr verschiedene Zielgruppen
- H√∂here √ñffnungs- und Klickraten

**Beispiel-Segmente:**

- Nach Reichweite (Leitmedien, Regionalmedien, Blogs)

### Tipp 4: √úberwache die Reputation deiner Domain

- [Microsoft SNDS](https://sendersupport.olc.protection.outlook.com/snds/)

**Warnsignale:**

- Hohe Spam-Rate (>0,3%)

### Tipp 5: Baue eine "Warm-Up"-Phase ein

3. Tag 8-14: 1.000-2.000 E-Mails/Tag
4. Ab Tag 15: Normaler Versand

**Warum?** E-Mail-Provider stufen pl√∂tzliche Versandspitzen als verd√§chtig ein.

## Rechtliche Hinweise

### DSGVO-Compliance

**Rechtliche Grundlagen f√ºr PR-Versand:**

1. **Berechtigtes Interesse** (Art. 6 Abs. 1 lit. f DSGVO)

   - Voraussetzung: Relevanz f√ºr die Berichterstattung

2. **Einwilligung** (Art. 6 Abs. 1 lit. a DSGVO)

**Pflichtangaben:**
- ‚úÖ Vollst√§ndiges Impressum (automatisch in Signatur)
- ‚úÖ Abmelde-Link (automatisch im Footer)
- ‚úÖ Datenschutz-Hinweis (Link zur Datenschutzerkl√§rung)

**Dokumentationspflicht:**
- CeleroPress speichert automatisch:
  - Versandzeitpunkt
  - Empf√§nger-Liste
  - Opt-Outs (Abmeldungen)
  - Bounces

### Wettbewerbsrecht (UWG)

**Unzul√§ssig:**
- Unaufgeforderte Werbung an Privatpersonen (B2C)
- Irref√ºhrende Betreffzeilen
- Verschleierung der Werbeabsicht

**Zul√§ssig:**
- PR-Versand an Journalisten (B2B, berechtigtes Interesse)

## Tastaturk√ºrzel

- **Strg/Cmd + Enter**: Versand starten (in Vorschau)
- **Esc**: Versand-Modal schlie√üen

## N√§chste Schritte

content.en:
# Send Press Release via Email

After preparing the distribution, you can send your press release to all selected journalists with one click. CeleroPress handles the complete distribution process automatically.

## What Happens During Distribution?

CeleroPress sends your emails **professionally and reliably**:

- **Personalized Emails**: Each recipient gets an individual email with personal salutation
- **Rate Limiting**: Distribution is controlled (10-20 emails/second) to avoid spam filters
- **Tracking**: Opens and clicks are automatically captured
- **Bounce Handling**: Undeliverable emails are automatically marked
- **Unsubscribe Management**: Unsubscribes are immediately noted in CRM

## Prerequisites

Before you can send:

- ‚úÖ Distribution was prepared (see [Prepare Distribution](/support/en/projekte/versand-vorbereiten))
- ‚úÖ All 3 steps of email composer are completed
- ‚úÖ Test email was sent and checked
- ‚úÖ Recipient list is correct
- ‚úÖ Domain is authenticated

## Immediate Distribution

### Step 1: Final Check

In the last step of the email composer, you see the **distribution summary**:

**Check:**
- Number of recipients (e.g., "142 recipients")
- Email subject
- Sender name and email
- Send time ("Immediately")

[Screenshot: Distribution summary with all details]

### Step 2: Start Distribution

1. Click the **"Send Now"** button (bottom right)
2. A confirmation dialog appears:
   ```
   Start Distribution?
   
   You are sending this press release to 142 recipients.
   Distribution cannot be canceled after starting.
   
   [Cancel]  [Send Now]
   ```
3. Click **"Send Now"** for final confirmation

### Step 3: Distribution Running

**Immediately after clicking:**

- ‚úÖ A **distribution job** is created
- ‚úÖ You're redirected to the **monitoring dashboard**
- ‚úÖ Distribution starts **within 30 seconds**
- ‚úÖ A **confirmation notification** appears

**Distribution Progress:**

You see live how many emails have been sent:

```
Distribution in progress...
üü¢ 42 / 142 emails sent (30%)

Estimated duration: 2 minutes remaining
```

[Screenshot: Distribution progress in monitoring]

### Step 4: Distribution Complete

After a few minutes, distribution is complete:

```
Distribution complete! ‚úÖ

üìß 142 emails sent
‚úÖ 140 delivered (98.6%)
‚ùå 2 undeliverable (1.4%)

Open rate: will be updated in the next hours
```

You receive an **email notification** with the distribution summary.

## Scheduled Distribution

Alternatively, you can schedule distribution for a later time.

### When is scheduled distribution useful?

- **Optimal Timing**: Send when journalists read their emails (e.g., Tuesday 10:00 AM)
- **Time Zone**: Send to international contacts at the right time of day
- **Embargo**: Client has embargo until a specific date
- **Outside Working Hours**: You don't want to work on weekends

### Step 1: Choose Schedule Distribution

Instead of "Send Now", click **"Schedule Distribution"**.

A calendar modal opens:

[Screenshot: Calendar modal for scheduled distribution]

### Step 2: Choose Date and Time

**Select Date:**
- Click the desired date in the calendar
- **Earliest**: Tomorrow
- **Latest**: 90 days in the future

**Set Time:**
- Choose hour and minute
- Format: 24-hour (e.g., 14:30)
- **Time Zone**: Your local time zone is used automatically

**Example:**
```
Date: Tuesday, January 15, 2026
Time: 10:00 AM (CET)

Distribution in: 2 days, 14 hours
```

### Step 3: Schedule Distribution

1. Click **"Schedule Distribution"**
2. Confirm with **"Schedule Now"**
3. Distribution is scheduled for the chosen time

**Confirmation:**
```
Distribution scheduled! ‚úÖ

Your press release will be sent on 01/15/2026 at 10:00 AM
to 142 recipients.

You can cancel the distribution until 09:55 AM.
```

### Manage Scheduled Distribution

**View:**
1. Go to **Project ‚Üí Monitoring**
2. Select your press release
3. In the header you see: **"Scheduled Distribution: 01/15/2026, 10:00 AM"**

**Edit:**
- Click **"Edit"**
- Change date/time
- Click **"Save"**

**Cancel:**
- Click **"Cancel Distribution"**
- Confirm with **"Yes, cancel"**
- Distribution is deleted (can be rescheduled later)

> **Important:** Scheduled distributions can only be canceled up to **5 minutes before send time**.

## Understanding Distribution Status

After distribution, each email goes through different statuses:

### Status Overview

| Status | Meaning | Action Required? |
|--------|---------|------------------|
| **Pending** | Email waiting in queue | No, distribution running |
| **Sent** | Email handed to server | No |
| **Delivered** | Email was delivered | No |
| **Opened** | Recipient opened email | No |
| **Clicked** | Recipient clicked link | No |
| **Bounced** | Email could not be delivered | Yes, check address |
| **Unsubscribed** | Recipient unsubscribed | No, automatically noted |
| **Complained** | Recipient marked as spam | Yes, remove contact |

### Bounce Types

**Hard Bounce** (Permanent):
- Email address doesn't exist
- Domain doesn't exist
- Recipient server permanently blocks

**Action**: Delete email address from CRM

**Soft Bounce** (Temporary):
- Mailbox is full
- Server temporarily unavailable
- Email is too large

**Action**: CeleroPress automatically retries 3 times

### Distribution Metrics

In monitoring you see these metrics:

**Delivery Rate:**
```
Delivered: 140 / 142 (98.6%)
```
- **Good**: > 95%
- **Acceptable**: 90-95%
- **Poor**: < 90% (check contacts!)

**Open Rate:**
```
Opened: 42 / 140 (30%)
```
- **Excellent**: > 30%
- **Good**: 20-30%
- **Average**: 10-20%
- **Poor**: < 10%

**Click Rate:**
```
Clicked: 12 / 140 (8.6%)
```
- **Excellent**: > 10%
- **Good**: 5-10%
- **Average**: 2-5%
- **Poor**: < 2%

**Engagement (Interactions):**
```
Engagement: 54 interactions (38.6%)
```
- Number of recipients who opened OR clicked the email

**Unsubscribe Rate:**
```
Unsubscribed: 2 / 140 (1.4%)
```
- **Acceptable**: < 2%
- **High**: > 2% (check content/frequency)

[Screenshot: Distribution metrics in monitoring dashboard]

## What Happens Technically During Distribution?

### 1. Job Creation (0 seconds)

- Distribution job is created in queue
- Recipient list is finalized (duplicates removed, unsubscribes filtered)
- Tracking pixel and links are prepared

### 2. Email Generation (1-30 seconds)

- A personalized email is created for each recipient
- Placeholders are replaced (e.g., {{FirstName}}, {{LastName}})
- Tracking URLs are generated
- HTML email is compiled

### 3. Distribution (30 seconds - 10 minutes)

- Emails are sent **in batches** (rate limiting)
- Per second: 10-20 emails
- For 142 recipients: approx. 7-14 seconds distribution time
- **Why so slow?** Prevents spam marking by email providers

### 4. Delivery (1-60 minutes)

- Recipient servers accept the emails
- Spam filters check the emails
- Emails land in inbox (or spam folder)

### 5. Tracking (ongoing)

- **Opens**: Tracking pixel is loaded ‚Üí open registered
- **Clicks**: Click on link ‚Üí redirect via tracking URL ‚Üí click registered
- **Bounces**: Server reports error back ‚Üí status updated

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

### Problem: "Distribution was rejected"

**Possible Causes:**
- Distribution limit reached (e.g., 1,000 emails/day)
- Domain not authenticated
- Email sender not verified
- Account suspended

**Solution:**
1. Check your distribution limit under **Settings ‚Üí Billing**
2. Authenticate your domain under **Settings ‚Üí Domains**
3. Verify email sender under **Settings ‚Üí Email**
4. Contact support for account issues

### Problem: "High bounce rate (>10%)"

**Cause:**
- Outdated contacts in CRM
- Incorrect email addresses

**Solution:**
1. Export bounced contacts
2. Delete hard bounces from CRM
3. Update email addresses for soft bounces
4. Use verification tools for large lists

### Problem: "Low open rate (<10%)"

**Possible Causes:**
- Emails land in spam
- Subject is not appealing
- Wrong send time
- Sender is unknown

**Solutions:**
1. **Spam test**: Send test email to mail-tester.com
2. **Optimize subject**: Shorter, more concrete, more relevant
3. **Send time**: Tuesday-Thursday, 09:00-11:00 AM
4. **Sender**: Use personal name instead of "noreply@"

### Problem: "Emails land in spam"

**Spam Prevention Checklist:**

- [ ] Domain is correctly authenticated (SPF, DKIM, DMARC)
- [ ] Sender name is professional (no "noreply@")
- [ ] Subject contains no spam words ("FREE", "CLICK HERE")
- [ ] No excessive use of capitals or special characters
- [ ] Text/image ratio is balanced (not just images)
- [ ] No oversized attachments (max 5 MB)
- [ ] Unsubscribe link is present (automatically included)
- [ ] "From" domain and "Return-Path" domain match

## Tips for Successful Distribution

### Tip 1: Send at Optimal Times

**B2B Journalists:**
- **Best Days**: Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday
- **Best Times**: 09:00-11:00 AM or 02:00-04:00 PM
- **Avoid**: Monday before 10:00 AM, Friday after 03:00 PM, weekends

**Consumer Media:**
- **Best Days**: Monday to Friday
- **Best Times**: 10:00 AM-12:00 PM

### Tip 2: Use A/B Testing (Premium)

- Send 10% to test group with **Subject A**
- Send 10% to test group with **Subject B**
- Subject with higher open rate wins
- Send remaining 80% with winning subject

### Tip 3: Segment Your Distribution Lists

**Why segment?**
- More relevant content for different audiences
- Higher open and click rates
- Fewer spam complaints

**Example Segments:**
- By topic (tech, business, lifestyle)
- By reach (leading media, regional media, blogs)
- By engagement (active contacts vs. inactive)

### Tip 4: Monitor Your Domain Reputation

**Tools:**
- [Sender Score](https://www.senderscore.org/) (0-100, >80 is good)
- [Google Postmaster Tools](https://postmaster.google.com/)
- [Microsoft SNDS](https://sendersupport.olc.protection.outlook.com/snds/)

**Warning Signs:**
- Sender Score < 70
- High spam rate (>0.3%)
- High bounce rate (>5%)

### Tip 5: Include a "Warm-Up" Phase

**For new domains/senders:**

Don't send thousands of emails immediately, instead:

1. Day 1-3: 50-100 emails/day
2. Day 4-7: 200-500 emails/day
3. Day 8-14: 1,000-2,000 emails/day
4. From day 15: Normal distribution

**Why?** Email providers consider sudden sending spikes suspicious.

## Legal Notes

### GDPR Compliance

**Legal Basis for PR Distribution:**

1. **Legitimate Interest** (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR)
   - PR distribution to journalists is generally permitted
   - Requirement: Relevance for reporting

2. **Consent** (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR)
   - Required for newsletters to end customers
   - Double opt-in procedure necessary

**Mandatory Information:**
- ‚úÖ Complete imprint (automatically in signature)
- ‚úÖ Unsubscribe link (automatically in footer)
- ‚úÖ Privacy notice (link to privacy policy)

**Documentation Requirement:**
- CeleroPress automatically stores:
  - Send time
  - Recipient list
  - Opt-outs (unsubscribes)
  - Bounces

### Competition Law (UWG)

**Prohibited:**
- Unsolicited advertising to private individuals (B2C)
- Misleading subject lines
- Concealment of advertising intent

**Permitted:**
- PR distribution to journalists (B2B, legitimate interest)
- Newsletters with prior consent
